alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 12:43AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: .A very moist air mass is in place across the High Plains with dew point values in the 60s to mid 70s resulting in precipitable water values of 1.25 to 1.75 inches. Thunderstorm chances increase during the late afternoon Wednesday and last through late morning Thursday. Heavy to torrential rainfall is expected which would exacerbate already saturated soils in the watch area. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Colorado and Kansas, including the following counties, in Colorado, Cheyenne, Kit Carson and Yuma. In Kansas, Greeley, Logan, Sherman, Thomas, Wallace and Wichita. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorm chances increase late afternoon Wednesday and last through late morning Thursday. Very heavy to torrential rainfall is expected which would exacerbate areas that saw flooding last week. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
